page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: { Our Domesday patch lies south-west of Newtown,in mid-Wales.It stretches from the river{Severn}in the valley to within one kilometre of the{hill {village}of Dolfor.Most of these hills are just over 300 metres.We think that a thousand years ago,when the first survey was made,this part of Wales was covered in forests and thinly populated.Today it is surprising how much it has changed.In the Mochdre Industrial Estate can be found thirty factories;there is a large sports centre,three schools,a college with a theatre,a college farm with a nature trail,two chapels and much more.On the hills are several farms keeping sheep,mainly.It is a beautiful part of Wales;unfortunately there is a lot of{unemployment}in our Domesday area.{
